column2: VA DRIVERS LICENSE TEST
Question Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. This sign means:
column4: you must yield to the traffic signal ahead.
column8: Traffic signal ahead
column10: The traffic signal ahead is out of order

column2: 2. This regulatory road sign indicates that:
column6: Vehicles must slow down and stay in the right lane.
column8: The right hand lane is reserved for buses and car-pool vehicles.
column10: Slower vehicles traveling on multiple lane highways must stay in the right hand lane.

column2: 3. This road sign means:
column4: Drive no less than 40 MPH around the curve ahead
column6: Curve ahead, the recommended speed is 40 MPH or less.
column8: The speed limit after the curve ahead is 40 MPH.
column10: Winding road ahead; slow down to the safe speed indicated

column2: 4. A flashing yellow light:
column6: can be found before reaching a sharp curve.
column8: warns drivers to proceed with caution.

column2: 5. This road sign means:
column8: One-way traffic

column2: 6. This road sign means:
column8: Side road

column2: 7. What does this sign indicate?
column8: Parallel railroad crossing (crossroad)

column2: 8. The ‘One Way’ sign means that:
column4: there is only one road that turns left at the intersection.
column6: drivers may travel only in the direction of the arrow.
column8: only vehicles turning left may travel in the direction of the arrow.

column2: 9. This road sign means:
column4: Drive only in the direction of the arrow
column8: Left turn ahead

column2: 10. Vertical rectangles tell drivers:
column4: that there's a school zone ahead.
column8: the law.

column2: 11. In Virginia, passengers under age 18 must be:
column4: properly buckled only if sitting in the back seat.
column6: properly buckled no matter where they are seated.
column8: properly buckled only if sitting in the front seat.

column2: 12. When making left or right turns, drivers should signal ________ before the turn.
column8: 50 feet

column2: 13. Unless otherwise posted, the speed limit in business zones is:
column8: 35 MPH

column2: 14. A Blood Alcohol Content (BAC) of _____ is evidence of intoxication.
15. The safest place to install a child safety seat is in:
column8: the center back seat.

column2: 16. The shape of a route sign tells you:
column4: the speed limit on that route.
column6: the type of route you are on.
column8: how many miles are left before you reach your destination.
column10: that the route you are on might be dangerous.

column2: 17. What should you do if a vehicle is approaching head-on in your lane?
column4: Decrease speed, pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other driver.
column6: Turn off the ignition if your vehicle has power steering.
column8: Come to a complete stop and use your horn to warn the vehicles behind you.
column10: Pull over to the left and use your emergency lights to stop the other driver.

column2: 18. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: they can not safely return to the right lane before they reach a solid yellow center line for the right lane.
column6: they are within 100 feet of a railroad crossing on a two-way roadway.
column8: they approach the top of a hill on a two-way road and can not see over it.

column2: 19. The size of motorcycles can cause you to misjudge their speed and distance. You should:
column6: use extra caution before you pull out in front of a motorcycle.
column8: check twice for motorcycles before pulling out into traffic.

column2: 20. If you see a “lane closed ahead” sign you should:
column4: speed to the end of the closed lane and try to get into the other lane.
column6: make a U-turn. You are on the wrong side of the road.
column8: merge into the correct lane when it is safe.

column2: 21. Curfew laws prohibit drivers under age 18 from driving:
column8: from 10 PM to 6 AM.

column2: 22. If the entrance lane is too short to allow acceleration to highway speed, you should:
column4: stop and wait for a large gap in traffic, then enter the highway and accelerate quickly.
column6: merge into highway traffic as soon as possible.
column8: go to the next entrance ramp.

column2: 23. When approaching any intersection or driveway, drivers should:
column4: drive at the fastest speed just before entering the intersection.
column8: look both ways and be ready to stop.
column10: pass other vehicles and then stop.

column2: 24. What is a likely effect when you take another drug while you drink alcohol?
column4: The effects of alcohol are reduced by the drug.
column6: The effects of the alcohol and the drug are enhanced.
column8: There are no effects, unless the drug is prescription only.
column10: If the drug is over-the-counter, there are no effects.

column2: 25. A vehicle that enters a road from a driveway:
column6: must stop and yield the right-of-way to traffic on the roadway and to pedestrians.
column8: must enter the roadway immediately.
column10: must yield to traffic approaching from the right, while it has the right-of-way over vehicles approaching from the left.

column2: 26. When an aggressive driver confronts you, you should:
column8: Report aggressive drivers to law enforcement authorities.

column2: 27. On slippery roads, drivers should:
column8: increase their speed to avoid hydroplaning.
column10: leave more space in front of their vehicle.

column2: 28. When the road is slippery, you should:
column8: press your brakes in slow, steady strokes.
column10: use your emergency or parking brake.

column2: 29. Who has a greater risk of being involved in a traffic crash?
column8: Drivers who are driving alone.

column2: 30. BAC is expressed in:
column8: AAI (Acute Alcohol Intoxication) level.
column10: ounces of alcohol in your blood.

column2: 31. Your drivers license will be revoked or suspended if you are convicted of:
column4: operating a motor vehicle while under the influence of alcohol or drugs.
column6: committing a felony involving the use of a motor vehicle.
column8: make a false statement to the DMV.

column2: 32. What should drivers do in case of a brake failure?
column4: Tie a white cloth on the left door handle.
column8: Use your ABS System.

column2: 33. You face a green light, but traffic on the other side of the intersection does not allow you to travel all the way through the intersection. What must you do?
column4: Wait until traffic ahead clears, so you do not block the intersection.
column6: Enter the intersection and wait until traffic ahead clears.
column8: Wait for the next green light.

column2: 34. Drivers need to change following distance when speed or road conditions change.
35. When approaching railroad tracks drivers should:
column4: look, listen, slow down and be prepared to stop.
column6: not pay attention to how many tracks there are to cross.
column8: try to drive around a lowered gate.
column10: speed up to cross the tracks before the gate is lowered.

column2: 36. At a stop sign there is no stop line or crosswalk. You must stop:
column6: after you enter the intersection, if you have a clear view of traffic on the intersecting roadway.
column8: only if the traffic signal turns red.

column2: 37. An edge line that angles toward the center of the road indicates that:
column8: you must turn right.

column2: 38. A speed limit is the __________ speed at which a vehicle may legally travel on the road under ideal conditions.
column8: maximum

column2: 39. Alcohol causes:
column8: loss of concentration.

column2: 40. At a light rail intersection, you should always:
column4: look both ways before crossing the tracks.
column6: share the road with pedestrians and bicyclists.
column8: be alert and obey all traffic signals.
